body.p: JLayerCheck is a tool to check module dependencies in Java programs. You can define groups of packages that should be a module and the allowed dependencies between the modules and the program will generate HTML output that shows an overview, which architectural violations were found, and generates HTML files containing the syntax-highlightes Java sources, where the problematic lines are marked.

The program was started some days ago (May 2007) and the website is not complete yet. If you would like to try the program, get it from the subversion repository and take a look at the testcases. The program uses maven, so you should be able to run the testcases by executing "mvn test".
Better documentation and more features will follow in the next days.
